verses.roman:
prātaḥ-kāla haite pāka karilā apāra
nānā vyañjana, piṭhā, kṣīra nānā upahāra

synonyms: prātaḥ-kāla haite—beginning from the morning; pāka karilā apāra—cooked many varieties of food; nānā vyañjana—varieties of vegetables; piṭhā—cakes; kṣīra—sweet rice; nānā—various; upahāra—offerings of food.
translation: Beginning early in the morning, Nṛsiṁhānanda Brahmacārī cooked many varieties of food, including vegetables, cakes, sweet rice and other preparations.
